name: Duck à l'Orange
instructions: 2. Score the skin on the duck breasts in a crisscross pattern and season with salt and pepper.

3. Heat the vegetable oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Place the duck breasts skin-side down and sear for about 4 minutes until the skin is golden brown. Flip the breasts and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and roast the duck for about 8-10 minutes for medium-rare. Adjust the time based on your preference.

5. While the duck is roasting, prepare the sauce. Zest and juice one of the oranges. In a saucepan, combine the orange juice, chicken broth, sugar, and red wine vinegar. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook for about 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. Add the orange zest and butter to the sauce, stirring until the butter is melted and well combined.
7. Remove the duck from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Slice the duck breasts diagonally.
8. Serve the sliced duck breasts with the orange sauce poured over the top.
description: Duck à l'Orange is a classic French dish featuring tender, juicy duck breasts cooked to perfection and served with a tangy and sweet orange sauce. It is a delightful combination of flavors that is sure to impress.
